name: 文學作品導讀（一）
goals: Learn key terms and concepts generally applied to the evaluation of literature
Hone skills of close reading and critical thinking
Develop curiosity about the world through context-specific analysis of literary works
Improve sensitivity to the English language
syllabus:
Week 1, Introduction

Week 2, Interpretation and hermeneutics / Ambrose Bierce, “An Occurrence at Owl’s Creek”

Week 3, Metaphor / William Shakespeare, selections from _Sonnets_

Week 4, Allegory / Nathaniel Hawthorne, “The Celestial Railroad”

Week 5, Symbol / Vladimir Nabokov, “Signs and Symbols”

Week 6, Genre / Annie Proulx, “Brokeback Mountain”

Week 7, Lyric / John Keats, “Bright Star”; Carol Ann Duffy, “Syntax”; Gwendolyn Brooks, “A Sunset of the City”

Week 8, Midterm exam

Week 9, Persona, tone, voice / Jennifer Egan, “Black Box”

Week 10, Poetic diction / Raymond Carver, “Cathedral”

Week 11, Authorship / Anon., “Though Amaryllis Dance in Green”; David Hume, “Letter

   from Pamphilus to Hermippus”

Week 12, Meter / Theodore Roethke, “My Papa’s Waltz”; e.e. cummings, “\[In Just;\]”; Dr. Seuss, _One Fish Two Fish_

Week 13, Style / Virginia Woolf, “Kew Gardens”

Week 14, Plot / Toni Morrison, “Recitatif”

Week 15, Point of view / James Joyce, “Araby”

Week 16, Final exam

Week 17, Consolidation

Week 18, Individual conference

methodologies.note: Each session will consists of roughly equal parts lecturing and group discussion of the week’s readings.
